intro: Octomeria bomboizae, commonly known as the Bomboizae octomeria, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
